intro: Sertifera hirtziana, commonly known as the hairy sertifera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Sertifera hirtziana is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
